short_description: Estimate the parameters for given VARMAX model.
long_description: Estimate the parameters for given VARMAX model based on SSE or ML method. User should provide the orders (number of parameters for each part) and period of the model, and the function will estimate the parameters accordingly.

input_tables.name: data
input_tables.rDescription: The table or view stores the input sequence.
input_tables.description: The table or view stores the input sequence.

input_tables.name: orders
input_tables.rDescription: It is the output table from TimeSeriesParameters.
input_tables.description: It is the output table from TimeSeriesParameters.

argument_clauses.name: ResponseColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the columns containing the response data. Null values are acceptable at the end of the series. If step.ahead is specified, the function will report predicted values for the missing values, taking into account values from the predictor columns for those time periods.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the columns containing the response data. Null values are acceptable at the end of the series. If StepAhead is specified, the function will report predicted values for the missing values, taking into account values from the predictor columns for those time periods.

argument_clauses.name: ExogenousColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the columns containing the independent (exogenous) predictors. If not specified, the model will be calculated without exogenous vectors.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the columns containing the independent (exogenous) predictors. If not specified, the model will be calculated without exogenous vectors.

argument_clauses.name: PartitionColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the partition columns that will be passed to the output. If not specified, the output will not contain partition columns.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the partition columns that will be passed to the output. If not specified, the output will not contain partition columns.

argument_clauses.name: Orders
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify the parameters p,d,q for VARMA model. This argument consists of 3 non-negative int values separated by commas. It should be three non-negative int values separated by commas. Those values should be between 0 and 20 inclusive.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the parameters p,d,q for VARMA model. This argument consists of 3 non-negative int values separated by commas. It should be three non-negative int values separated by commas. Those values should be between 0 and 20 inclusive.

argument_clauses.name: Method
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the method for fitting the model parameters: SSE (Default): Sum of squared error. ML: Maximum likelihood
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the method for fitting the model parameters: SSE (Default): Sum of squared error. ML: Maximum likelihood

argument_clauses.name: SeasonalOrders
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify seasonal parameters sp,sd,sq for VARMA model. This argument consists of 3 non-negative integer values separated by commas. Those values should be between 0 and 20 inclusive.If not specified, the model will be treated as a non-seasonal model.If the seasonal.orders argument is used, the period argument should also be present.
argument_clauses.description: Specify seasonal parameters sp,sd,sq for VARMA model. This argument consists of 3 non-negative integer values separated by commas. Those values should be between 0 and 20 inclusive.If not specified, the model will be treated as a non-seasonal model.If the SeasonalOrders argument is used, the Period argument should also be present.

argument_clauses.name: Period
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the period of each season. Must be a positive integer value. If the period argument is used, the seasonal.orders argument must also be present. If not specified, the model will be treated as a non-seasonal model.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the period of each season. Must be a positive integer value. If the Period argument is used, the SeasonalOrders argument must also be present. If not specified, the model will be treated as a non-seasonal model.

argument_clauses.name: ExogenousOrder
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the order of exogenous variables. If the current time is t and exogenous.order isb, the following values of the exogenous time series will be used in calculating the response: Xt Xt-1 ... Xt-b+1. If not specified, the model will be calculated without exogenous vectors.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the order of exogenous variables. If the current time is t and ExogenousOrder isb, the following values of the exogenous time series will be used in calculating the response: Xt Xt-1 ... Xt-b+1. If not specified, the model will be calculated without exogenous vectors.

argument_clauses.name: IncludeMean
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify whether mean vector of the response data series (constant c in the formula) is added in the VARMA model. Default value is False. Note that if this argument is True, the difference parameters d (in the orders argument) and sd (in the seasonal.orders argument) should be 0.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether mean vector of the response data series (constant c in the formula) is added in the VARMA model. Default value is False. Note that if this argument is True, the difference parameters d (in the Orders argument) and sd (in the SeasonalOrders argument) should be 0.

argument_clauses.name: IncludeDrift
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specify whether drift term is included in the VARMAX model. Default value is False. Note that this argument can only be True when d is non-zero and less than 2.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether drift term is included in the VARMAX model. Default value is false. Note that if this argument can only be True when d is non-zero and less than 2.

argument_clauses.name: Lag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the lag in the effect of the exogenous variables on the response variables. For example, if lag = 3, and exogenous.order is b, Yi will be predicted based on Xi-3 to Xi-b-2. Default value is 0.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the lag in the effect of the exogenous variables on the response variables. For example, if Lag = 3, and ExogenousOrder is b, Yi will be predicted based on Xi-3 to Xi-b-2. Default value is 0.

argument_clauses.name: MaxIterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: A positive integer value. The maximum number of iterations performed. Default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: A positive integer value. The maximum number of iterations performed. Default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: StepAhead
argument_clauses.rDescription: A positive integer value. The number of steps to forecast after the end of the time series. If not provided, no forecast values are calculated.
argument_clauses.description: A positive integer value. The number of steps to forecast after the end of the time series. If not provided, no forecast values are calculated.
